comments.commentBody:
re: #53

with apologies to Star Trek, your problem could be solved by using transparent aluminum (foil). If you find the good stuff unobtainable, you could alway peel back the regular foil and have a look....
Kingfish! It's plentiful here and amazingly versatile.

I find it much easier on several levels to just skip fish entirely, apart from wild shrimp, farmed mussels, and my beloved squid.  All are sustainable, easier to cook IMO, and hugely versatile.  Plus no nasty fishy-smelling house!
How could this article be written without mentioning tilopia, an excelltent white fish fillet that is very sustainable.
Broiled, Sautéed, Roasted, Poached - these recipes are variations of ONE method = use the basic preparation add/omit/skip ingredients as indicated - very novice instructions!

After this deplorable action by the Chinese authorities, I believe the US should stop initiating all cultural and educational  programs, and stop financing those already in progress with China, until Mr. Wei and other human rights' defenders are released.  The USA and other Western countries know very well the fate that human rights prisoners endure, yet most remain silent.  With every week it seems that brave Chinese people like Mr. Wei are beginning to pay a high price for the West's inexcusable silence.  This price is the loss of their liberty and freedom.  It's time for everyone who cherishes these values to speak up every time that cooperation with China is discussed in their community and work place and to shine a light on the great injustices suffered by so many people at the hands of the corrupt and insidious Chinese government.

The Great Chinese Singularity

Our theories about how things should work in the world have been turned upside down by the Chinese over and over.

We thought no nation could lift 300 million people out of poverty in just 30 years without political freedom. The Chinese have proved us wrong.

We thought only in democracy the government could work efficiently and get everything done correctly. The Chinese have proved us wrong.

We thought no communist country could ever get rich and kick our behind economically. The Chinese have proved us wrong.

We thought capitalism and entrepreneurship worked best only in a capitalistic free society. The Chinese have proved us wrong.

Inside our country, we thought immigrants who are poor and don't speak the language would fail in school and be at the bottom of the class academically. The Chinese immigrants have proved us wrong.

During the Gold Rush, we thought no unskilled peasants could build a transcontinental railroad. The Chinese labors have proved us wrong.

Knowing all of these, I would be too afraid to make any predictions about China and the Chinese based on our generally accepted theories that we view narrowly through our Western glasses. We don't know what they know, how they think and are capable of doing. They will simply defy our expectations and common sense again and again. Like my Indian friend says, the Chinese have a different DNA from the rest of us.

Another demonstration that "free trade" rewards repressive regimes.  Goods can be imported and jobs moved from democratic countries lured  by a regime that represses dissent and allows no independent organizations. Corporate executives who want to "lower costs" by avoiding independent unions or getting rid of the ones they've got and want to prevent public criticism of their actions find that the Chinese regime will eagerly do these things for them.

Granted, Ai Wei Wei is absolutely brilliant. But I am curious, are there any other contemporary, Chinese artists besides Ai Wei Wei? After all, China is a fairly large country. In the U.S., we get to talk about Jeff Koons AND Richard Prince. In England they have Damien Hirst and Rachel Whiteread. Perhaps we can wait for Larry Gagosian to tell us the next great Chinese artist.
Bachman is almost as ridiculous as Obama.  both sides keep electing the worst candidates

NO! she is not hot! She is, in fact colder than Minnesota and Palin's Alaska combined!

She is out to lunch and out of sync with mainstream America!

Her pronouncements are outrageous and outlandish! She ain't hot nothing politically!
I hope she will eventually read our Constitution and take some history clases. That would be nice for a constitutionalist, as she alleges to be. Her crazy eye look scares me a bit too!

She is ultra right wing and has plenty of support across america.  Get ready readers she is looking good right now, and whatever my feelings used to be about Obama, his right of center attitude has made me realize this whole thing about being liberal is just plain stupid, so I'll preach my left wing philosophy and watch the government move more and more right.  At this point I'll vote for Bachman  in the primaries and let's see what happens to Obama as he tries to move further right.  There may not be that big a difference, and at least with Bachman we know what we're getting.
She might somehow win the GOP primaries, but in the campaign, her Tea Party shallowness and sloganeering will do her in.

I think Sarah Palin has found what she's looking for at Fox News: Cash.

She would need to start pronouncing her G's if she wanted to think about the presidency.

To the people of the 6th district of Minnesota:
Your joke on the rest of the nation has run its course. It's not funny anymore. Please vote this woman out of office.

On a serious note, is this really the best and brightest your district has to offer? Does this woman seriously represent the majority of you?

Michele, Make My Day: RUN !!!!!!!!!

But before you do you must a) take a refresher high school course on American history- particularly that period you want us as a Nation to go back to. b) a high school freshman course in arithmetic so you can figure out that the Libyan conflict doesn't cost 0.6 billion a day or that Obamas visit to India cost some 25 million a day (it would break your budget in no time if you were to achieve that lofty position); c) speaking of India you should pay a visit there for a day or two to hone your foreign policy expertise.
It’s going to be tough fight to win the nomination against such formidable opposition. But your supporter Mr. Sorensen knowingly said “I don’t want to bash Sarah Palin, but she lacks substance, I believe Michele Bachmann has more substance. I think she’d mop the floor with her...” But substance in this context should mean something solid and strong like steel, but here Sorensen's metaphor invokes instead floor cleaning suds- just more of this vapid stuff than he assumes Palin is endowed with- but right on target, nevertheless. The only other item I found baffling is that people have already contributed $ 13 million to her coffers, which counters the Tea Partiers demand for jobs- do they really need jobs if they have that much money to through in the waste can?
HMMMM. i thought she was most well known for not knowing the constitution and making factual errors about american history.....

Michele Bachmann could certainly attrack attention during the primary season. Iowa, with its very conservative Republican voters, gives her an early edge over the likes of Romney. Were she to be the nominee, however, she stands little chance on the national stage. One serious problem with starting in Iowa, especially with Republicans, is the voters force the candidates to take positions likely not in line with mainstream voters, even other conservatives, let alone moderates. This bloc is necessary to be a serious candidate. Can Bachmann have success in say Ohio, where she would have to be at least credible in the Cleveland area? What about Florida?
Another issue with Bachmann and Palin is their desire to make everything so simple, black and white. Both draw a sharp contrast with their political opposition. That is fine during an election season, but Bachmann and Palin have continued using vitriolic language. Serious office holders must understand the complexity of deal making and national and international affairs. There is a time to run for office, and there is a time to govern.

Shouldn't one of the requirements for running for President be that the person is intelligent, thoughtful and well advised in all areas relating to that so important office ?

This woman strikes me as having none of the above qualifications. The thought of her sitting next to the red button (if one exists) ... the one that says 'launch' ... that is truly frightening.

Michele Bachmann is a true Republican, the real thing, an unabashed, uninhibited wacko, a "fine" graduate of that bastion of higher education, Oral Roberts University, where faith matters so much more than facts...
Oh, please run, Michelle.  Please!
Never thought they could top (meaning 'go lower than') Palin. Shows how much I know about the Grand OLD Party.
Bachmann and Palin in 2012!  I'm sure the GOP could come up with a stupider pair, but not prettier.  And obviously, that's important.

Populist rhetoric can only take you so far. In the case of Michele Bachmann that's far right. If she is convinced that her ideas are best for this country then she SHOULD run for president. The American people can decide for themselves (or in this case Republican primary voters) if she's worthy of leading this great nation. We don't need the press to tell us what to think. I personally think she would have a difficult time winning over any Democrats and few Independents in a general election. However she will push the eventual Republican nominee farther to the right.  Ultimately, Republicans will have to field a candidate that appeals to a wide electorate if they want to win votes from moderate Democrats and Independents. This is unlikely with Michele Bachmann on the ticket.
